post_info.post_title: Look I hate the things now occurring in Georgia. Definitely, President of Georgia is

Nikolai

My greetings! I live in Georgia. My wife is Georgian, but I am Russian. To be honest, what's happening here I cannot name in any other words but lawlessness and xenophobia! I've been living here for 10 years already but it never was so terrible like now. After Saakashvili became president, the attitude to non-Georgians (not only Russians like me but also Armenians, Greeks, Ajarians, Azerbaijanis, etc) was turning worse and worse! After the recent happenings in South Ossetia our life is a nightmare! I fear to go out of house and prefer not to do without acute need. I would gladly leave Georgia till it calms down if only I could to - Georgian authorities merely won't allow us go away! Once I was close to be bereft of my ID. I was walking along a street when some policeman stopped me and said to show him my ID. When I gave it to him, he nearly tore it into two halves! I was lucky to wrest it from his grasp and the policeman was about to beat me up for that. Thank God I was quick enough to run away from the place! It is also impossible to go to Russian embassy. Some thugs are loafing thereabouts the embassy and I fear even to approach them! In such a manner we became outright hostages of Saakashvili's regime. Our life became terrible and we cannot leave the country. I don't know how long we can keep living like that. Which is the worst thing, the West don't seem to accept the reality and keep exculpating Saakashvli though the real troublemaker is him!

According to the information I used to come across on various forums, these groups were secretly trained by US army specialists at the witting of authorities of Ukraine and Baltica region countries and with the task to commit various acts of sabotage along with acts of provocation both on the territory of Ukraine and Baltic region, but not there only. During the recent armed conflict between Georgia and South Ossetia, these guys were also said to appear in Georgia where they had a task of discrediting Russian peace keepers under request of Saakashvili by mere disguising into Russian military uniform and slaughtering the population of a small village near Kutaisi, Georgia. 
 
 It looks like that Saakashvili got fond of that method. TRUK

I think it should become obvious that what happened in Georgia and South Ossetia (the genocide of Ossetian peaceful populace if you still don't know) was an act of aggression by Georgian president Saakashvili approved by Washington. Though it seems to me that you-know-who in Washington did not really understood what Saakashvili's aggression might result in. Just for your information, Georgia is a very important element of energy security of quite many states - the whole Southern Europe, Mediterranean states, India, China, Israel, and... that may sound paradoxical - the US itself! Nowadays Georgia transits Azerbaijani crude oil (via the BTC and Baku-Supsa oil pipelines, and railroad to the port of Poti, Batumi and Kulevi) and gas (via the Baku-Tbilisi-Erzurum gas pipeline). There is also plan for the Nabucco pipeline project. So it turns out that launching war against South Ossetia imperiled all these oil&gas projects, which was first and foremost a miscalculation of Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice.
